description.narrative: Advancing Papua New Guineas National Adaptation Plan through the National Adaptation Plan Project implemented by United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and Climate Change Development Authority (CCDA).

activity-description.narrative: The project is targeted at Government partners and stakeholders who are committed to work in this space of climate change and its impact. This project will be located in Port Moresby because it is where all or most of the beneficiaries (Government partners) and key sectoral agencies are based. The p

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Indicators for Activity Result 1: (1) Report on analysis of existing laws, policies and plans (2) Action plan (report) on barriers to planning and budgeting in key sectors/stakeholder (3) Trainings and sensitization workshops (4) Awareness raising materials developed and disseminated. (5) Action plan (report) on NAP formulation (6) Assessment report on capacity gaps (7) Capacity development plan (report) (8) Training programme implemented (9) Indicators and procedures developed and integrated into IKM. 10) Climate information collected and integrated into IKM national portal. (11) Trainings conducted on use of climate information and monitoring. (12) E-newsletters and IKM portal updates.
Indicators for Activity Result 2: (1) Appraisal tools adopted, guidelines for integration and prioritization developed and trainings conducted on application of tools. (2) EIA updated. (3) Recommendations on alignment of CCA indicators to PNG’s SDGs, NDC (report). (4) A report on gaps in vulnerability assessments identified for inclusion in second phase. (5) A report with list of appraised prioritized adaptation action.
Indicators for Activity Result 3: (1) CCA markers for PIP developed (2) IFRS updated with CCA relevant budget codes (3) Report on investments in CCA published on IKM (4) Financing strategy (report) .

comment.narrative:
Baseline for Activity Result 1: (1) Regulatory and policy frameworks do not sufficiently address climate change adaptation. (2) Climate change adaptation awareness is low amongst key stakeholders at national and sub-national levels. (3) Limited technical capacity to coordinate climate change (4) Limited capacity assessments for climate change integration (5) Limited information on monitoring and knowledge management system, and lack of gender-disaggregated climate change information.
Baseline for Activity Result 2: (1) Economic analysis not conducted while choosing appropriate options (2) Adaptation priorities are not integrated into MTDP, NDMP and sectoral policies. (3) Scattered information on climate vulnerability assessments.
Baseline for Activity Result 3: (1) Lack of financing strategy to support medium to long term adaptation action (2) CCA considerations non-existent in public investment programmes.

Targets for Activity Result 1: (1) Review of policies and plans conducted, and reforms are initiated. (2) At least 200 stakeholders sensitized on climate change adaptation. (3) Steering committee strengthened to support key functions of adaptation planning. (4) Capacity gaps identified and addressed through training of at least 50 people from various national and sectoral departments. (5) Gender sensitive indicators developed and at least 50 persons trained to update IKM national portal.
Targets for Activity Result 2: (1) System for economic appraisal of options established (2) CCA priorities integrated into national and 4 sectoral policies (3) Existing information is reviewed and compiled.
Targets for Activity Result 3: (1) Financing strategy developed, and sources of financing identified; adaptation investment ideas developed. (2) Public investment programmes include criteria for climate change adaptation.

Activity Result 1: Part of (1) Review of policies and plans conducted, and reforms are initiated - Inception report and Action plan for the development of the NAP has been completed and endorsed by the Project Board. Part of (3) Steering committee strengthened to support key functions of adaptation planning - TORs for the Technical Advisory Group (TAG) and Adaptation Technical Working Group (TAG) have been completed.
All other activities have been deferred to 2021

Targets for Activity Result 1: (1) Review of policies and plans conducted, and reforms are initiated. (2) At least 200 stakeholders sensitized on climate change adaptation. (3) Steering committee strengthened to support key functions of adaptation planning. (4) Capacity gaps identified and addressed through training of at least 50 people from various national and sectoral departments. (5) Gender sensitive indicators developed and at least 50 persons trained to update IKM national portal.
Targets for Activity Result 2: (1) System for economic appraisal of options established (2) CCA priorities integrated into national and 4 sectoral policies (3) Existing information is reviewed and compiled.
Targets for Activity Result 3: (1) Financing strategy developed, and sources of financing identified; adaptation investment ideas developed. (2) Public investment programmes include criteria for climate change adaptation.

Activity Result 1 (1) Review of policies and plans conducted, and reforms are initiated - policy and legislative analysis completed (2) At least 200 stakeholders sensitized on climate change adaptation- partially completed with full completion in 2022. 3) Steering committee strengthened to support key functions of adaptation planning - recommendations for improvement of the Adaptation Technical Working Group have been completed. (4) Capacity gaps identified and addressed through training of at least 50 people from various national and sectoral departments - Capacity Development Plan completed with implementation set for 2022 (5) Gender sensitive indicators developed and at least 50 persons trained to update IKM national portal - this activity has been deferred to 2022
Activity Result 2: (1) System for economic appraisal of options established - draft has been developed with feedback from CCDA set for 2022 (2) CCA priorities integrated into national and 4 sectoral policies - Draft NAP completed for finalization in 2022, ensuring this area is addressed (3) Existing information is reviewed and compiled - Document on all adaptation initiatives has been completed
Activity Result 3: (1) Financing strategy developed, and sources of financing identified; adaptation investment ideas developed - in progress for completion in January 2022 (2) Public investment programmes include criteria for climate change adaptation- in progress for completion in 2022

Activity Result (1) At least 200 stakeholders sensitized on climate change adaptation- partially completed with full completion in 2022. (2) Capacity gaps identified and addressed through training of at least 50 people from various national and sectoral departments - Capacity Development Plan completed with implementation set for 2022 (3) Gender sensitive indicators developed and at least 50 persons trained to update IKM national portal
Activity Result 2: (1) System for economic appraisal of options established - draft has been developed with feedback from CCDA set for 2022 (2) CCA priorities integrated into national and 4 sectoral policies - Draft NAP completed for finalization in 2022, ensuring this area is addressed
Activity Result 3: (1) Financing strategy developed, and sources of financing identified; adaptation investment ideas developed - in progress for completion in January 2022 (2) Public investment programmes include criteria for climate change adaptation- in progress for completion in 2022
